p: The recipes call for “ teel oil, ” or sesame seed oil, which in ancient times is likely to have “been made from scratch,” just as the plant pastes. We did not have access to the equipment or familiarity with the processes needed to “press” oil from sesame seeds, and hence used sesame oil procured from a local source. This commercial oil source is routinely used by present-day Ayurvedic practitioners. It would be important to consider variations in the properties of the oil based on the source of the raw seeds and processing conditions ( Shahidi et al., 1997).
